Legal_Issue: Whether farming, in combination with accountancy, constitutes the chief source of income under s. 31(1) of the Income Tax Act
Evidence_Assessment: Time spent (60% on farming), capital investment in farming, profitability of accountancy vs. uncertainty in farming, magnitude of farm losses (> $500,000)
Burden_of_Proof: On taxpayer to demonstrate farming was chief source of income
Legal_Rule: Farm losses deductible under s. 31(1) only if farming is the taxpayer's chief source of income, or combined with a subordinate source
Grounds_for_Claim: Defendant sought full deduction of farming losses restricted by the Minister
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim denied; farming not chief source of income
Key_Evidence_Considered: Time allocation, financial investment, income from accountancy, lack of farm profitability
